channel.title: dessert on Brayden's Recipes
channel.description: Recent content in dessert on Brayden's Recipes

item.title: Paleo Ginger Molasses Cookies
item.description: Source: Ambitious Kitchen Prep Time 5 minutes Cook Time 8-11 minutes Total Time 14 minutes Notes Makes about 10-15 cookies. Can be doubled or tripled easily. If coconut sugar is not available, granulated or raw sugar will both work. Ingredients 1/4 cup melted and cooled coconut oil 1/4 coconut sugar 2 T molasses 1 egg at room temperature 1 t vanilla extract 1 cup almond flour 1/4 cup coconut flour 1/2 t baking soda 3/4 t ground ginger 1/2 t cinnamon 1/2 t allspice 1/4 t salt Extra sugar for rolling Directions Preheat oven to 350 degrees F In a large bowl, mix together cooled coconut oil, coconut sugar, molasses, egg, and vanilla extract.

item.title: Apple Green-Chile Pie With Cheddar Crust
item.description: Source: New York Times Ingredients Crust 1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour ¼ teaspoon salt ⅓ cup cold unsalted butter, cut into dice ½ cup grated sharp Cheddar cheese 5 tablespoons ice water, more as needed Filling 5 cups peeled and thickly sliced tart apples, such as Jonagold, Honeycrisp or Granny Smith ½ cup chopped roasted green Hatch chilies, mild or medium hot (see note) 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice ½ cup granulated sugar ¼ cup light brown sugar ½ teaspoon cinnamon ¼ teaspoon allspice ¼ teaspoon nutmeg, preferably freshly grated ¼ teaspoon salt ¼ cup cornstarch Topping ½ cup all-purpose flour ½ cup finely chopped walnuts ¼ cup light brown sugar 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted Vanilla ice cream, for serving Directions Make the crust: In a food processor or mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, combine flour and salt.

item.title: Classic Spritz Cookies
item.description: Source: Wilton Home Ingredients 3 1/2 c all purpose flour 1 tsp baking powder 1 1/2 cups softened butter 1 c granulated sugar 1 egg 2 Tbsp milk 1 tsp clear vanilla extract 1/2 tsp no-color almond extract Directions Preheat oven to 350. Combine flour and baking powder. In large bowl, beat butter and sugar with electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add egg, milk, vanilla, and almond extract; mix well.

item.title: Cheesecake
item.description: Source: Unknown Ingredients 1 graham (or other) crust 2 pkg cream cheese 1/3 c sugar 1 tbls milk 1 tbls vanilla 1 egg Directions Mix everything but the crust together. Pour the mix into the crust. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 for 30 minutes. Let cool and enjoy.

item.title: Blackberry Vinegar Caramel
item.description: Source: Bon Appetit May 2014 Issue Ingredients 1 c sugar 1/4 c unseasoned rice vinegar 10 oz fresh or frozen blackberries (can use raspberries instead) Directions Cook sugar in a medium saucepan over medium heat without stirring, until it begins to turn golden brown around the edges. Stir to incorporate melted sugar and cook, stirring occasionally, until all sugar is melted and caramel turns a deep amber color, 6 to 8 minutes.
